results.title: Dr Spock
results.brief_description: Presents the theories and practice of Dr. Benjamin Spock and his suggestions to parents for dealing with the problems, foibles and characteristics of children from infancy to the age of six.

results.title: Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Paul Killiam Film Classic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This 1920’s film with John Barrymore was the first great American horror film. It was a tour-de-force for Barrymore, and a classic of macabre film making. This edited work retains all the ingredients for which it is famous. The narration points out its significance in motion picture history and provides interesting comment on the craftsmen who made it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Paul Killiam Film Classic

results.title: Downhill
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Actor Michael Kane stars in this brief winter romance filmed partly in the dazzling outdoor splendor of a Laurentian ski resort and partly in the cardiac wing of a city hospital. It is the story of a man’s second youth, the time in his middle years when he overstrains his passion for life and love. A stolen weekend, and the inevitable reckoning; between these two, the hills themselves serve the drama like members of the cast.

results.title: Down to Sussex
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: South Down and Weald - open space and green woodland. This is Sussex, a county rich in scenic beauty. History shows itself everywhere, right back to the threshold of legend - The Long Man of Wilmington and Chanctonbury Ring. All this the present day traveller can see and enjoy, together with the present day delights of Petworth Show, Goodwood Races, polo at Cowdray Park, Glyndebourne and the Sussex Coast. Narrated by Peter Halliday.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: Down through the years: a random view of Montreal
results.creator_credit: Jacques Giraldeau, Marcel Martin, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A poetic view of Montreal. To the rhythm of excerpts from ‘Jazz Sebastian Bach’ by the Swingle Singers - a vocal group from France - the camera explores the old city and the new. In the city modern skyscrapers mushroom skywards, but all around are ancient streets and monuments jealously guarding the memories of another time: including Bonsecours Church, La Place Royal, Le Theatre des Saltimbanques and Dickens Street.
results.title_for_label: Down through the years: a random view of Montreal
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Giraldeau, Marcel Martin, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Down the rivers with Sturt
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday, Australian Instructional Films and Stamina Clothes
results.brief_description: Deals with the exploratory work of Charles Sturt; the discovery of the Murray-Darling-Murrumbidgee river system solving the mystery of the rivers, the 1829 expedition westward down the Murray to the sea. Surveys the area today: the Murrumbidgee irrigation area, its chief towns; the wide variety of primary industries - rice cultivation, stoned and citrus fruit production, cattle and sheep raising.

results.title: Down in the forest
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams, Australian National Film Board, Department of Information and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description: The monarchs of the forests, the kangaroos, spend their lives in leisure, in cleaning and feeding their young and in friendly tussles. In the background the koalas, native wild cats, cus-cus and possums are the courtiers in the kingdom of the forest.

results.title: Douglas Point Nuclear Power Station
results.creator_credit: Atomic Energy of Canada and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: The success of this first full-scale nuclear power station on the shores of Lake Huron has shown the way for the economic large-scale production of electricity from uranium. This film describes the plant at Douglas Point, Ontario, and the process by which the uranium atom is split, employing heavy water with a special property, deuterium, giving the name CANDU (Canada Deuterium Uranium) to the Canadian system of atomic energy production.

results.title: Dough and dynamite
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Mack Sennett and Keystone Film Company
results.brief_description: A Charlie Chaplin comedy concerning labor trouble in a bakehouse. Slapstick comedy at its best. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Charley Chase, Edgar Kennedy, Slim Summerville.
